value.title: DAX Fridays! #167: Calculate previous row using DAX
value.excerpt: You have been asking me, how do I calculate previous row in Power  BI using DAX so I can get new cases on the corona dataset? , and this is exactly what we are going to do in this video. value.title: DAX Fridays! #183: How to deal with multiple dates in Power BI
value.excerpt: So you have order date, shipped date, required date....and only one calendar. How do you manage that in power bi and DAX?  This scenario is often called role playing dimensions and in this video I will show you two ways to solve it. :) Happy Friday!!  Links to videos mentioned: Introduction to data modeling:

value.title: DAX Fridays #214: Create DAX calculations on ranges taken from a slicer!!

Sales variance between multiple years 2. Rank across multiple years and many more!  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: DAX Fridays! #27: RELATED vs RELATEDTABLE

value.title: DAX Fridays! #29: HASONEVALUE
value.excerpt: Have you ever got this error message?: A table of multiple values was supplied where a single value was expected ?  If you have, make sure to check out this video to understand how to solve it.  HASONEVALUE is a DAX function that will check if the table returned has one value or not. If it has, it will

value.title: DAX Fridays! #40: DATESINPERIOD (Moving x Months average)
value.excerpt: In today's video we will learn how to use DATESINPERIOD function using Moving Average calculation.  First we will explain what a Moving average 3 months is and how it is calculated.  Later on we will build a measure that will explain how datesinperiod is used.   EXCEL SURVEY: https://1drv.ms/xs/s!Ar8CDNp8cGTcgjaHonN82T8I1jQT

value.title: DAX Fridays! #42: SUBSTITUTE (multiple values)
value.excerpt: In today's video, we will learn how to use the DAX function SUBSTITUTE.  Substitute changes text for another text. We will do two examples, how to substitute one value for another and how to substitute multiple values.   Northwind dataset: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k3NMIlLffrU  EXCEL SURVEY: https://1drv.ms/xs/s!Ar8CDNp8cGTcgjaHonN82T8I1jQT

value.title: DAX Fridays! #44: CROSSFILTER
value.excerpt: IN todays video, we will go trough an example on how crossfilter works. Crossfilter can simulate relationships and active and deactivate them as you need to. It is very useful for solving issues with many to many relationships and performance issues.  Northwind dataset: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k3NMIlLffrU

value.title: DAX Fridays! #66: TREATAS
value.excerpt: In this video we will go through the DAX function TREATAS.  The TREATAS DAX function allows us to create virtual relationships within tables or pass filters to tables that are not related.  Link to function in glossary:  https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/treatas-dax   Link to SQLBI blog post: https://www.sqlbi.com/articles/propagate-filters-using-treatas-in-dax/

value.title: DAX Fridays! #97: STANDARD DEVIATION EXPLAINED | Who is the best player, LeBron or Durant?
value.excerpt: Who is the best player, Duran or LeBron? Let's find out using statistics and standard deviation.  Get Northwind Dataset: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k3NMIlLffrU  Download file here: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/stdev-s-dax  More on STATISTCAL DAX FUNCTIONS here: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLDz00l_jz6zxc8iinR39euGqFm4SDabBf
